Reviews.Title: “Just a it too far from City Center”
Reviews.Author: Vasilios F
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was OK, nothing special. The staff on the other hand were helful with bus information and calling us a cab. In terms of price, this hotel was affordale especially during the New Years when I had gone but had I known better I would have spent a bit more and booked a hotel closer to the city center!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from action”
Reviews.Author: KrishnaD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a long long way from the center of the City. Its a long drive from all attractions, airport, railway station etc. Nothing much to choose from inside the hotel too. Breakfast was too simple.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: chandraknee
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite budget friendly brand in Europe! Found this hotel on Expedia and was so impressed with the quality and service I booked an Idea Hotel in Milan later in my business trip! Awesome modern design, great breakfast with lots of options for me and my colleague who dreamed about the Idea Hotel spread the rest of our trip through Europe. Great service and even gave great recommendations for late night food haunts just down the street. Also take note even though it is quite some distance from the city center, they offer a free shuttle to the metro so we were great at making that savings work for us too!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Italian style”
Reviews.Author: Roefamily
Reviews.Content: This is a modern well appointed hotel at very very reasonable prices ,it is well connected to the road system and is a business hub hotel and used by coach tour operators for easy access to the road system. Superb breakfast spread but be early if there are two coaches at the hotel ,Rooms are light and airy clean and ample towels soap ,shower gel etc.Nice flat screen ty with sky channels .I am a little puzzle by some back comments made by other travellers this is a really smart place. There is a large supermarket close by for those travelling on a tight budget ,plus it is in an urban area so lots of places to eat ,nice pizza down the street opposite and Carrfour supermarket so it is well serviced.Our trip was on a budget so we used Public transport and walked ATAC the city transport service has a great website with a how to get to route finder easy to use and very helpful.Buses and trams can get quite crowded .

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Franknap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the outskirts. The shuttle is a pain and waiting for the bus to where you are shuttles to is ok. Bunch of vendors selling all different stuff. The hotel itself is clean, nice rooms, and great breakfast. Take a walk past the shopping center and go to some of the restaurants, great food. We found a wine shop that sold us a gallon of wine we picked from the vat and poured it into an empty water bottle. Kinda cool! cheap too but good vino! Need to pay for internet but why bother going on vacation if you're surfing the net! Prego!

Reviews.Title: “Badly planned shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: Fountainhall_10
Reviews.Content: 1.The proximity of this hotel imposes plenty of restrictions because of limited accessibility to its location. One has to be on the shuttle at the latest 1030 to get into town and at 2130 to return to the hotel. Between 1030 and 1845 there is no shuttle service. After these hours, take the public transport 451 to/from Ponte Mammolo metro station. One one occasion we got bumped off the shuttle by the driver as he wanted to accomodate somebody else (guess why??). Not wanting to create a scene on the shuttle and delaying other perople we got off and took up the matter with the receptionist (Emmanuella??) and the hotel manageress who promised to investigate with the driver (not George but the other one). No explanations to date forcing me to surmise their cowardly behaviour! 2. As for the hotel, the rooms were ok - airconditioner hardly having any effect. The cleaners never did a completely satisfactory job. Either they forgot to replace to tea tray or never vaccumed the carpet or omitted to do the bed altogether. We had to get these complaints rectifed via the reception. On 3 occassions the locks refused to open up on swiping the card and once we had to change the room becasue they could not programme the key due to a broken down machine. The mattresses need replacement as most perople we spoke with complained of back aches when we met up in the breakfast area. 3. The reception staff tried to be as helpful as they could especially Daniel went out of the way to make us comfortable. 4. The supermaket and the cafeteria behind the hotel was a boon as we could not find restaurants nearby. Finally, I expected Holiday Inn Express to be forthright about its limitations on shuttle services. I beleive this site is now an Idea hotel using the Holiday Inn Express brand.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better options”
Reviews.Author: RichardR_10
Reviews.Content: OK if you are able to speak Italian - Breakfast OK - Staff 50% helpful

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler48_10
Reviews.Content: Beware of the location. The hotel would like you to think it is just a quick shuttle ride to the subway taking you down to city center. What they do not tell you is that there is one (1) 16 person shuttle to serve this hotel and another hotel across the street. You actually do not catch the shuttle at the Holiday Inn Express Rome East. Between the two facilities there are hundreds of occupants. Lines are long for the shuttle and some people are rude, often jumping on the bus without waiting their turn. Tempers can flare. If you miss the last shuttle back at 9:30 PM, good luck. You have to catch the public bus and then walk from the bus stop through less than ideal neighborhoods back to the hotel. If you have the bad luck to miss the closest bus stop and get off "down" the bus line, good luck. It took us 2 hours too walk back, and all the policewoman we found could indicate in sign language, no they don't all speak english, was stay together, keep your eyes open, they attack from the dark. I was also amazed that our driver from the airport to the hotel could find it. Rooms were OK and breakfast comparable to other Holiday Inn Express hotels. The positives can not overcome the negatives of the location. The staff we had spoke minimal english.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there three times now!”
Reviews.Author: cormonger
Reviews.Content: The staff are great and will give you maps and bus directions to use in the city. The prostitutes are an absolute pain as you try to get back to the hotel from the local bus stop, they won't move to let you go past and the area has rubbish and old needles around. Not to be reccommended if you have small children. Get a travel card from the tabacchi for as many days as you are going to be in the city and it gives you unlimited travel on buses,trams and the Metro. Supermarket next to hotel. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Far from ideal”
Reviews.Author: SapphireEngland
Reviews.Content: Express by Holiday Inn East in Rome is out in the middle of nowhere.We booked there because they claim to have a free shuttle bus every 30 mins to the nearest Metro.For the duration of our stay there was no shuttle bus in operation,although the hotel did on one occasion pay for a taxi to the metro which cost them 10 euros.The lack of the shuttle was a huge minus as the 451 bus does go to the metro but coming back it is very hard to figure out the right stop as the hotel is well away from the main road and dingy on the outside. Inside the hotel is nice and new and very clean.No bath,but a lovely powerful shower.The free buffet breakfast is handy and consists of rolls,meat,cheese and cakes,cereal,fruit juice & coffee.There is a huge supermarket a one minute walk away that does have a little coffee shop/snack bar as well.There are tea & coffee making facilities in the rooms but the air conditioning would not blow cool! Staff were helpful and pleasant and understood English.The only English speaking telly channel was CNN unless you paid extra,but when in Rome etc! We would not stay here again as it is just too out of the way and we did not dare come back after dark as we would never have got off the bus at the right stop!! It is easy to get to the airport via public transport for a lot less than a taxi fare though.

Reviews.Title: “Miles away from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: rex_banner
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel as a “pit stop” on a road trip rather than a place to stay when visiting Rome. We spent a fortune on Taxis over the few days we were there, the price depending on the route / driver / time it was €20-€30 each way getting to the city centre and €75 from the Airport. One Driver turned up with €13 on the clock to collect us claiming it was so far out he had to start the meter for it to be worthwhile! The hotel is fine, clean and basic, the day staff were friendly enough, and breakfast was not bad, (although you need to be up early to get any of the hot stuff). We really struggled with the Air-con too, it stayed hot all the time no matter how cold we set it, so we ended up switching it off and opening the large window all night. The Hotel is in the middle of nowhere, ( Taxi drivers moaned when you showed them the address) its surrounded by Electrical towers and buildings progress, It says that it is 5k from The colosseo… they must have moved it the week we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: BanzChicago
Reviews.Content: Terrible location. Air-conditioning was not on even tho it was warm for October. Shuttle bus times are limited - no afternoon service. Local bus stop is a distance away. Breakfast buffet runs out of eggs early in the morning. Area is under construction - so there is noise all day.......also near a concert tent....of course a concert was in full sound and fury as we came back late from Rome on the local bus. Music was heard thru our closed windows without the air conditioning........ key lock did not work until after going back to the front desk three times....... Hotel staff was indifferent to most of our concerns. I would have no recommendation for this place. Stay away! Mr Robert Banzin

Reviews.Title: “We loved the convenience of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: neena_19
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be just what we needed. We travelled with two very small children and the staff were friendly and helpful (unlike the rest of Rome which seemed to be full of people unwilling to help tourists). The area was a little 'seedy' - but then we found most of Rome to be the same! We never had a problem with the shuttle bus - we always managed to get on. The Metro was fantastic and cheap. We were deposited right out the front of the major tourist attractions within minutes of leaving Ponte Mamalo station. The supermarket near the hotel was a real eye-opener for these Aussies - we had tonnes of fun trying out all the interesting foods we found, we saved heaps of money stocking up on softdrinks and snacks and it was great to get out and be amongst the people who live in Rome. As we had the children, we didn't go out at night, except for a trip to the pizzeria around the corner (delicious)! This hotel might be a problem if you were wanting to tour Rome by night as I imagine taxi fares to the hotel would be very expensive. Breakfast was yummy and plentiful, great coffee too. For a group of travellers (with a double pram) who wanted to save money for spending, this was a perfect retreat. We have recommended it to close friends as a great option for those travelling with children. We would DEFINATELY stay there again (if we're lucky enough to return to Rome!)

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma!”
Reviews.Author: NE_FamilyJourney
Reviews.Content: We stayed on this Hotel and it was perfect for us! Just a places to drop our suitcases and leave early in the morning and come back to sleep let at night. We were just to get around the city as much as we could with our kids were 3 and 6 and they enjoyed it. Closed to the subway! And like 20 min. ride to the city. There were 2 double beds so the four of us shared. Overall I would say this is a great hotel for the price if you are just looking for a place to sleep, shower, have breakfast and take the road till late night. Perhaps not the most convenient if all you want to stay in the facilities, but if you want a clean please to stay, look no more!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Lousy Location”
Reviews.Author: holidays_in_beirut
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, arrived late, thankfully by car as the shuttle finishes at 10:00pm, a desolate area, with many prostitutes working the nearby streets. Hotel itself was as one expects from Holiday Inn Express, modern, clean and very good breakfast by Rome standards, however we did have to change room as the previous occupant had decided to smoke himself stupid, judging by the number of cigarette ends and stench of this dedicated non smoking room. Housekeeping seem to be a law to themselves so when things were taken away like the kettle and tea/coffee, the very helpful duty manager provided a drink from the cafe/bar on the house which was pretty good of him. I understand this is an area that is seeing quite a bit of development, but opening a hotel with such poor local infrastructure and obvious social problems expecting to attract both business and tourist travellers seems a little arogant. The staff do their best but the problems with the neighbourhood mean this will not be a place I shall return to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely basic, not far from Rome centre or airport if using car”
Reviews.Author: Lemonjuice06
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like it in the middle of knowwhere but actually it's pretty good! Lovely for families with cars. It has a giant supermarket next door and round the corner from the main road "Prestina" which takes you straight into Rome. Service there is very good, most hotel staff are English speaking. Hotel has big rooms but is basic & nice breakfast so you need to bring food back with you from Rome centre to eat in the evening. They say it's really noisey & agressive if you stay in Central Rome so we were glad we stayed here. We hired a car which also helped & to take a map with you & make your own directions to the hotel then you have no probs at all! Rome is really nice & the people are really friendlt & helpful would definately go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of nowhere!”
Reviews.Author: m4ril0u
Reviews.Content: Our first impression when arrived in the hotel was that we are doomed to never see Rome!!!! It gives you the impression that is far far away from the city center. The truth is that it is not more than 5 minutes as long as you have a car. For us who were using taxi this hotel proved to be the wrong choice because all our money went to taxis. Apart from the location issue it was a nice hotel, clean and not very expensive with helpful staff. Breakfast wasn't anything special either.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast was good”
Reviews.Author: turbotel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights. The staff in general were helpful and cheerful, breakfast was good, room was very clean and the air con was a blessing as the temperature was 96F! The hotel was in the middle of nowhere byt transprt was good. The 451 bus is an excellent frequent service, but you have to fight your way past prostitutes after mid-afternoon to get to the hotel across some wasteland!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, long way from town.”
Reviews.Author: WilliamHo
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weekend in Rome, 15th-18th June 07, where we we spent three nights at this hotel. The staff were helpful and courteous. The facilities were what you would expect from Holiday Inn Express with one exception - no kettle in the bedrooms! If you want tea or coffee you need to buy it at the bar. There's an adequate buffet breakfast included in the room cost. The hotel location is a bit remote, 20 -25 minutes on the underground and another 10 in the free minibus. The bus waits outside the left side entrance to the station [your left when facing the city centre]. The surrounding area is under development and will probably look quite different in a couple of years. Meantime its a bit of a sight with graffitti on every available space, but then almost the whole of Rome seems to be somebody's scribbling pad! There is a large supermarket immediately beside the hotel and a street of local shops on the far side of the supermarket. The only eating places we found were Pizzerias. The one we used each night served good, inexpensive Italian food and the staff were delighted to try out their English language to explain the menu.

Reviews.Title: “Away from everything”
Reviews.Author: traveller20000
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean and nice. The staff are great. BUT, the location of the hotel is really far from everything. If you want to go downtown, then euther use a taxi which cost at least 25 Euros and 45-60 minutes each way or take the hotel shutel and metro. If you stay here then you go out in the morning and propably come back late at night. As you see there is no way to go back for some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: BZ91
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Holiday Express Inn, Rome East, last November 2nd, 2006 for 3 days with my wife and our 2 kids. I have read some bad comments and hesitated for a while but finally decided to go for it. The price was very interesting. I have to say that the hotel is very clean, the rooms are large comparing to european standard and the staff was kind with one exception but that's an exception. The breakfast is very good. The hotel is actually located outside Rome at about 2 kms from the nearest metro station (Ponte Mamolo). The metro takes you to Rome Termini (central) in 15 mns and I do not consider this as a problem. The only problem is that you need to take the shuttle to go to the metro station. The shuttle is a courtesy of the hotel and the trip is less than 5 minutes but DO NOT expect to walk to the metro as you need to cross highways and we haven't seen walkways. Also the shuttle departs from the hotel and back every 30 mns from 7h30 to 11h00 and then from 17h00 to 22h00. A taxi from downtown would cost around 20-30 Euros. Next to the hotel there's a large supermarket that closes at 21h30 but no restaurant or animation. As a conclusion, if you're looking for a good quality/price ratio, if you don't need to have a break at the hotel during the day then you could find this hotel ok for you.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you have car”
Reviews.Author: Sandridge
Reviews.Content: Knowing Rome quite well we booked this hotel.However even the taxi driver from the airport got lost and did not know where it was.The taxi was also 65 euro which is rather expensive.Once at the hotel they provide a 1/2 hour bus service to the nearest metro but unfortunately this only seats 16 people and many people were complaining as they could not get a seat on the bus (the hotel did not offer to put more transport on despite the hotel being very busy - we struggled to get a table at breakfast !).It is not possible to walk to the metro, also the metro is not in a good part of town so it would not be ideal travelling back late at night from the center of Rome - we did not see any taxi's at the station .Therefore i would only recommend this hotel if you are happy to drive- the hotel is basic but clean , the staff are helpful but their English was not great .The bar is very very basic and not somewhere you can really relax but the breakfast buffet is ok.At £99 a night it was far too expensive for just a bed which is a long way out of the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: TJBF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located outside of Rome. They do have shuttles that take you to and from the subway station but they only run at certain times of the day. The staff is rude and corrupt. The first night we were recommended to go to an overpriced restaurant where the hotel staff clearly receive a kick-back. What a rip off. Then the a/c was not working, we were told that a technician would come to look at it but the next day we were told that a/c is seasonal and it had been shut off for the season. Ridiculous, not what you would expect from a "chain" hotel. It was still September and 30 degrees, how can you shut the a/c off for the season??? Internet was also down for the entire stay. Save your money and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice - good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: suns4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn at Via Giorgio Perlasca, Rome East in September. The room was clean and had 2 English channels on TV. There was no pool and there was no internet access as the PC had broken down. Breakfast buffet was good. We parked in the secured car park as the surrounding areas did not seem very safe. We took the hotel shuttle to the metro station but always missed it on the way back. We had to take the local bus 451 back. We reached before the hotel shuttle even though we had to walk about 10 minutes from the bus stop to the hotel. Laundy Fonda Blu was very economical and the Auchon close by was very convenient. We found the hotel easily as we had GPS.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: pamilya
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel quite ok reasonably priced for a family of four (2 kids stay free) and decent inside... the location is not the best, not the easiest to get to.. it's about 20 minutes from the centre of Rome via the Metro getting off at Ponte Mammolo station and then a bus ride away from there... the hotel does provide a shuttle bus to/from the Metro station but it only runs in the morning (up to 10am) and at night from 6pm so if you arrive there outside those times you will need to take the public bus which always seems to be packed and you need to know where to get off.. so make sure you get the public transport details from the hotel before you arrive (there don't seem to be many taxis near the station either) . The area near the hotel doesn't seem too bad with lots of vacant lots around and a grocery/general goods store and a circus nearby however the train station area doesn't seem as safe although we did not see/notice any incidents. Make sure you eat or bring food before you get to the hotel there are no restaurants or other shops nearby that we can see (even around the train station).. so if you get stuck at the hotel the snack vending machine downstairs is all you got. Breakfast is included in the price and includes hot food, cold cuts (salami, ham, mortadella etc) and fresh fruit... the rooms are clean and reasonable... not bad value considering all the other hotels around Rome (in spring) are pricey compared to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Inexpensive Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speech529
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation in advance at this hotel based on reviews posted on this site. We paid in advance, so we were committed to being there. We were happy with the hotel and the price. We would stay there again. It was affordable (79 euros for 4 people with breakfast and free parking). The hotel was clean, rooms were spacious enough to accommodate two adults and two teenagers. The breakfast in the morning was very good (cereal, fresh fruit, bread, pastries, yogurt, all hot drinks, juice, Italian cold cuts and cheeses, eggs). The kitchen staff did not speak English, but the reception staff did. They were very helpful and accommodating. Yes, the hotel is on the outskirts of Rome and you should have a car if you plan to stay here. We rented a car in Paris and drove to Rome. Contrary to all the published reports, driving in Rome was no worse (maybe even easier) than driving in downtown Boston, Massachusetts, USA. The hotel has a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes or so to the train station. From there, you take a train to the Metro. We did not find this mode of travel convenient, plus strikes by public transport workers are common and unpredictable. There is nothing in the area of the hotel in which to see. No restaurants or sites. It is a residential area, but if you want to save money and can get yourself into Rome, stay here. Since we rented a car, we did not buy the 11 euro pass for the buses and metro. We were very pleased with our situation. We were glad to have a car as there were several strikes by public transportation workers. On the first day, the taxi drivers were striking, onthe third day all of the public transportation was shut down for the day (taxi, bus, metro). It took us about 40 minutes to get into Rome and find parking on the first day. Thereafter, it was about 25-30 minutes. The parking was within walking distance of most major sites, except the vatican. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Holiday Express Rome East”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday to Rome staying at the Holiday Express Rome East which we were extremely dissapointed with to say the least. If you are thinking of booking it my advice would be not to bother. It is really in the middle of nowhere apart from a supermarket nearby(the only redeming feature). There are no other hotels or restaurants(apart from a wee pizza takeaway). No bars either and the hotel bar closes about 11pm! And don't expect them to have any change for the vending machine! There was a lot of derelict land with graffiti everywhere. There is a shuttle bus but it only takes you to a local subway station at certain times of the day. Some of the staff tried to help(and they are certainly not bilingual as claimed) others had no interest in helping. The sky tv is in Italian. The hotel seemed clean enough, but not nearly as nice as the Holiday Expresses we have stayed in in Scotland though. If you have already booked your holiday make sure you have a really good guide book, and learn some Italian, and take plenty of euros for the taxi's!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel, quite a bit of travelling to the centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: didi-doodah
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was the cheapest one that I could find that looked quite modern, clean and to have decent facilities. And yes it does have good facilities for the money, the room was a good size with decent air conditioning and a nice early check in time. As all the other reviews show the hotel is quite a long way from the city centre. It does have good connections to the city centre. To get to the hotel you need to take metro line B (blue line) to Ponte Mammolo and then go down the escalator and go outside to the left. The hotel shuttle goes from right outside this exit of the metro station but does not run between 11am and 6pm. There is a local bus, the 451 that goes from outside the station too and this runs very frequently until midnight. Be aware you need to push and shove your way onto all buses and metros as that is what everyone in italy does and being polite gets you nowhere. You need to stay on this bus for 6 stops, it is a very busy bus so you can notice 6 stops easily, if not when you see the circus looking tent on your right or the hotel itself on your right press the button to stop the bus. The hotel does seem to be very near to a lot of prostitutes who do not bother you at all but do seem to be around from mid afternoon and go into the fields which are not very concealed! we saw more than we wanted to see! To use the metro and the buses you get a ticket from the metro stations, this ticket is valid for both trains and buses but you need to validate the ticket in one of the stamping machines at the entrance to the metro or on the bus as if you do not have one or have not validated it you can get a large fine. Once you have validated it then you can just walk on and off the trains with ease. Overall the hotel is a nice hotel for the money but if i went again i would pay that bit more and stay more central as we struggled to get home at night as the metro stops at about 11pm. A taxi to the hotel from the centre cost us about 25 euros so its a bit expensive to do every night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent clean hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and were very happy with everything. I would only recommend it. There is a small shuttle bus, lets say for 18 people, which runs every 30 minutes from the hotel to the nearest underground station called Ponte Mammolo, which is on the line B. Once you get on the underground or Metro as the italians call it, you get anywhere you like, so for someone with commom sense it is very easy to get anywhere. The ticket for the train journey cost 1Euro and you get 75 minutes in which you can change as many times as you want. If you want to travel all day using the underground then is better to purchase the ticket for 4Euros and that's valid till midnight and you can use the same ticket on any bus, so that was great too. The hotel bus does not run between 11.00 am till 6.00pm assuming that people are seesighting and only be coming back at around 6.00pm which is fine. If you miss the shuttle bus, there is a local bus number 451 just outside the underground station which will take u near the hotel and you can use the ticket you used all day on the Metro. Rooms were spotless, bathrooms same, no kettle though in the room, but we had a small travel kettle to make our tea or coffee. Every morning from 7,30 till about 11 the breakfast was served downstairs, buffet style and the choice was great, you had croissants, pastries, jams, fresh bread, baguettes, scrambled eggs, cereals, yoghurts, selection of freshly squeezed juices and coffees. If you needed anything else to eat, there is a large supermarked just behind the hotel called Auchan . After the Auchan you will get to the street with some restaurants and small shops too. The weather was excellent considering it was beginning of April, we could not ask for better. Staff was very nice too, they understood english and gave us maps and directions when we asked, they even allowed us to leave our luggage at the reception after we checked out at 12.00 noon, because our flight was later on that evening and we did not want to drag the suitcases with us, while going to Rome for couple of more hours. You don't have to take the taxi for 45 Euros from the CIAMPINO airport, there is cheaper way - just take the bus from outside the Ciampino to Anagnina underground station and then get from there to Ponte Mammolo station and from there either the free hotel bus or the normal 451 bus mentioned above and you will save so much money.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean rooms and good breakfast. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Johnny7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large, clean and the breakfasts were good. The shuttle bus drove us to the metro and picked us up, which probably took an extra 1/2 hour of travel time, but the price was great and it was nice to be in a quiet area outside of Rome. One room did not have heat for 2 nights and the internet did not work, but we were still happy.

Reviews.Title: “right hotel wrong location SEP 06”
Reviews.Author: blogerl
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the express by holiday inn rome east for 5 nites Had searched the web looking for an affodable hotel say £50 anite got the idea that if you want to stay in the heart of the city £50uk WOULD NOT GET YOU THAT MUCH OF A HOTEL e.g.clean beds, secure room, tea and coffee makeing facilieties, hairdryer, phone, internet, tv. and breakfast. showers that when you put it on, the toilet did not back up into your room so you had smelley carpets. I had read lots of reviews (too many in fact) that had complained about all of the above but were in the heart of the city. This hotel gives you all the good points i mentioned, BUT..it is out of the way BUT the hotel does provide a free shuttle bus every 30 mins to and from the subway wich takes you into the city inabout 15 mins the cost of the subway 1euro, but it can be a pain having to make your way back after a long day out, and there is no were to go around the hotel EXCEPT ABOUT 2 RESTERAUNTS but if you have been out all day then all you want is your room, the breakfast is what won me over deluxe 100 items mmmm no it was poor for me anyway, but there were things that i did have all types of coffee cerials pastries fresh fruit, juices breads ,the scrambled egg and bacon was poor...so there you have it A very nice clean room, large breakfast if you like there breakfast that is. but not in the city, cost from campion airport 35euro in taxi if you decide to make your way to termini the shuttle bus outside the airport is ok for6euro rite outside the door to termini except if you arrive in the dark hours i would get ataxi to your hotel not so nice looking in the dark and watch the pickpockets there good...ps the open top red buses are great for the day, takes you to all the sites get on and off when you want 13euro ..

Reviews.Title: “staying here is a balancing act”
Reviews.Author: TexasLove2trvl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through internet and prepaid for 3 nights after much research.We had few options within our budget as we were 2adults/2children.The positive: Rooms and bathrooms are clean;good breakfast buffet,however eggs tasted"instant";price is very good for Rome; Shuttle to metro is helpful when in service. Neutral aspects: Some staff helpful/others uninterested in giving "detailed" information when asked, that would have been helpful and saved us time and energy; breakfast room gets pretty crowded and tv is loud. The negative: LOCATION It is quite a ride from Rome center, and between metro stops and changes and catching the bus to the hotel, one can expect it to take around 40min... Unless of course,if you miss your bus stop and get out on the next one (hotel said 6th stop but that doesn't mention possibility of people ringing for unscheduled stops)than it could take longer. It is only a 10min walk to hotel from bus stop but that was passed quite a few prostitutes even in the middle of the day;So I suppose it goes without saying that the area is pretty "seedy". last negative: no screens in room so mosquitos can make an appearance. If you decide to book hotel, here are some helpful hints: There is no air condition but windows do open (unlike most hotel windows in States).There is a laundromat (Fonda Blu) about 15min walk that has reasonable prices and you can just leave laundry and pick up--they wash and fold--or self serve. If you take bus from metro, it's really difficult to count 6 stops if people ring for extra stops, and it's possible to miss hotel, it's wise to ask bus driver to let you know "Hotel Express Holiday Inn".The bus stop closest to hotel has a little bench and covering. We also double checked with people on bus who were helpful. Oh yes, shuttle runs approx. 7am-11am and then again in evening so be aware there's no shuttle service between those hours. All in all I think you just have to weigh pros and cons to and see if it all balances out. I think that next time we'll save a few more pennies beforehand and stay in Rome central.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie234
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Rome, I booked reservations at the Holiday Inn Express Rome East primarily because of name recognition and a decent price. Not all that many "chain" hotels in Rome to choose from. We stayed on the front and back ends of a Carnival cruise out of Civitevecchia; 4 nights on the front-end, 3 nights on the back-end. The hotel accomodations were basically clean. My only real problem with cleanliness were some "questionable" stains on the bedspread on our second stay. The bathrooms were well kept. The breakfast buffet had something everyone could enjoy, but when you're there for a while it does get dull and predictable. In the breakfast area, there is a big-screen tv, which the staff likes to keep turned up way too loud on an MTV-type station. This hotel is in the suburbs of Rome. The hotel-sponsored tour provider is happy to pick you up to take you to the tour terminal downtown, but will not bring you back to this hotel, like they will for tour-takers they pick up closer to the city center. What a surprise and inconvenience this was! You either need to return (and pay additional) on the metro, or find a taxi (and pay a lot more additional) that will bring you back. It was difficult finding taxi drivers in the downtown area that either knew where this hotel was or if they did, would agree to take you there. We found a nice, little restaurant close to the hotel to have dinner. The Auchen store (Italian Wal-Mart, as we called it) right next to the hotel was convenient. The staff at the Holiday Inn Express Rome East was mostly helpful and friendly, and were able to speak and understand English. Loved Rome, and if I ever return there, will probably pay the extra bucks and stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... not easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice inside. But getting there is a challenge if you don’t have a car. You most first go to next too the last metro stop and then take the hotel shuttle the rest of the ways or take a bus from that metro stop (6 bus stops to the hotel). O, and the metro/bus stop is not a clean or safe (well it did not feel safe) area. One other thing you should know. The shuttle runs till 10 PM. If you miss it then it is the bus for sure (or Taxi). One night a taxi cost us 17 Euro from the main train station (not too bad). One other things to know about the hotel. The rooms are for 3 adults or 2 adults and 2 children. You can book it for 4 adults, they will sell you 4 adults and then they try to charge you for a roll away bed. It took me calling the corporate office to honor their agreement. Other wised the hotel itself is in a safe location and it is quite nice. Good breakfast. But I would not stay there again due to the distance and the difficulty of getting here. But the price was right (90 Euro per night)

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: IBCD
Reviews.Content: Room Rate: 2 kids below 12 stay free per room. This bonus is harder to find in Italy. Car: Free car parking. Close to highway exit. Public Transport: Convenient shuttle to subway station, 2 miles away. Food. Decent free breakfast (in small crowded room). Groceries. Large supermarket next door. Good wine cheap! Rooms: Usual functional clean rooms. General Location: Quite a dump! Was this an ex-industrial estate?! Dinner options: Quite poor, or we looked in the wrong direction :-(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. the rooms were excellent as was the generous free breakfast. The bar is open 24 hrs, what more could you want. We were a little apprehensive before we arrived because we had read some of the other reviews but you have to wonder what people expect for the rates available in this hotel. If you want the Ritz, pay for it. The area around the hotel was not so good but there was a large and excellent supermarket right behind the hotel which we found useful. You will spend all your time in central Rome anyway. There was no resturaunt (only breakfast is available) in the hotel but you can have food delivered and the staff will help you with this. The hotel was a fair distance from the centre of Rome but there was a free shuttle bus to the metro station which took only about 5 mins and from there it was a 10 to 15 mins metro ride to central Rome. The suttle bus ran every 1/2 hour from 6.30 to 11.00 in the mornings and from 18.00 to 22.00 in the evenings. Outside of this there was a public bus stop about 5 mins walk max from the hotel and we used this a few times with no bother at all. The last stop for the bus is right outside the metro station and the hotel is 6 stops from the metro station on the way back. Rome is a great city and this is an excellent hotel for the price and i would have no problem returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast, bad location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the Holiday Inn Rome East, Hotel is very nice, very clean and the staff are friendly. The breakfast is excellant with all sorts to choose from. The only drawback is the terrible location, the area is basically on par with unused industrial land and only occupied by prostitutes and kerb crawllers! Reception will recomend a local restaurant where the staff are really friendly and the food good (although don't ask for extra salt!) Getting into Rome Central is okay if your up early enough for the shuttle bus to the nearest metro station, but if your not it can be a struggle if you don't know the buses. However the bus can be caught about a 5 /10 minute walk from the hotel and this along with the metro should have you into the heart of Rome (Termini) in about 45 minutes. Overall a really nice place to stay for a reasonable price but it just seemed an odd place to have a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only drawback is the location in relation to the attractions in Rome but there is a shuttle to the subway so for the price it was a good deal. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful. The store nearby is very interesting and there are lots of stores and places to eat within walking distance. The apartments that you can see from your room are on top of stores and restaurants. The field beside it is used as a walking area for the locals and their dogs which was entertaining. The breakfast was far better than what we had at The Westin Excelsior downtown that we also stayed in. For someone on a budget I recommend Express by Holiday Inn East.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, and the breakfast....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff friendly, much better than in Florence ...the breakfast was fantastic...with food being so expensive, it was almost worth the cost just to eat there (I'm exaggerating )... free shuttle to the subway was nice, but doesn't run all day....room was ok, very clean, with a very strange window/door with no screen....I never saw a window screen in Italy....location is bad, but I got a good deal thru the airline so I can't complain about that...

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, shady not so decent area.”
Reviews.Author: carpotx
Reviews.Content: Really a shame that this hotel is in such a horrible location. It was so far out of the way that we actually had 3 cab drivers refuse service due to the hotels remote location. (This hotel, is no where near the center or heart of rome.) When we did finally get a cab, the driver, at arrival of the hotel, told us to be very aware of our surroundings. The hotel is surrounded by a real "shanty" town. Hookers hang out just off the Hotel property. On the other hand, the hotel staff really go overboard in trying to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Breakfast buffett, Shuttle to and from hotel to Metro stop and very large rooms were a huge plus. Our room had a mini balcony...too bad there really is no view. There is a large store immediately behind the hotel. It is equivalent if not bigger than any U.S. Super Walmart. The store has EVERYTHING. If you plan to be a true tourist and want the hotel mainly to be a clean place to sleep, stay. If you like to get up, walk around, see and be amongst the locals, stay away. Our flight left early am to the airport and the hotel hired a private car for us. The driver showed up early, 4:45am instead up 5am, was very curteous and professional. 60 Euros. Beleive it or not, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “wrong location”
Reviews.Author: Brucewat
Reviews.Content: Hotel very comfortable, staff very friendly. Biggest problems are the hookers dissapearing into the bushes with their clients in the road leading to the hotel. The shanty town in the field behind the hotel. Courtesy bus is only morning and evening. apart from supermarket at back you are surrounded by empty and full of rubbish sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, So-So location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent room size, helpful staff, very good breakfast, and as other reviewer mentioned large supermarket with sight of the hotel. Only bad.. the hotel is kind of in the middle of no where, you are dependant on the shuttle that runs between the hotel/train station. When it stops running, you better know which bus to catch.. and look out for the gypse hookers.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good, but not as bad”
Reviews.Author: Spades
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely furnished, very cozy and adequately sized. Staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was good and plentiful. Hotel was a bit out of reach of public transportation, the public bus was a good 10minutes walk..ok if its a nice day, but very miserable if you have allot of luggage. They however they provided a complementary shuttle to/from the train station which ran on the hour. Hotel had local food menus and accepted deliveries which was nice. There is also a huge supermarket across the parking lot from the hotel, if you choose to get fresh fruits and veggies and bread. TV was ok...had local Italian channels, there are only 2 English stations which was CNN and BBC. Would stay again, but only if I was running thin on choices...good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Idea Hotel Rome East
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giorgio Perlasca 50, 00155 Rome, Italy
